"According to the Yami customs, they would rub the lard [on a woman who recently
gave birth]. It was put in a water container [i.e., half a coconut] to bake. The
baked lard was very fragrant. After she was rubbed with lard, she went to the

"According to the Yami customs, they would rub the lard [on a woman who recently
gave birth]. It was put in a water container [i.e., half a coconut] to bake. The
baked lard was very fragrant. After she was rubbed with lard, she went to the
(138) ikongo do iyangay ta saon a tao am, mi-koris so aneng no koyis ori, pangay-in da do praranom a ka-atap da ja, ka-hangno na no aneng ori am, ka-pikoris na rana, ka-ngay na rana do takey ori a.

reason LOC custom 1PGEXCL only LIN person TOP AF-rub OBL oil GEN pig that put-PF 3PG LOC water_container LIN ka-bake 3PG there very-smell 3SG GEN oil that TOP ka-rub 3SG already ka-go 3SG already LOC mountain that PAR

According to the Yami customs, they would rub the lard [on a woman who recently gave birth]. It was put in a water container [i.e., half a coconut] to bake. The baked lard was very fragrant. After she was rubbed with lard, she went to the mountain.

tier.item: (152) [o dengdeng-an namen so raet] a vanga
NOM cook-LF 1PGEXCL OBL fish_name LIN pot

The grammaticalization (Hopper & Traugott 1993) of ya from a deictic "this" to a third person
singular nominal pronoun "he/she/it" and eventually a modal auxiliary is a topic for future study.
"The pot in which we cook rahet fish and the plate on which we put it are what

aka no [o pangay-an namen so raet] a kakanan am,

The grammaticalization (Hopper & Traugott 1993) of ya from a deictic "this" to a third person
singular nominal pronoun "he/she/it" and eventually a modal auxiliary is a topic for future study.
"The pot in which we cook rahet fish and the plate on which we put it are what
[o dengdeng-an namen so raet] a vanga aka no [o pangay-an namen so raet] a kakanan am, [i-panci namen] a raratan.
NOM cook-LF 1PGEXCL OBL fish_name LIN pot and GEN NOM put-LF 1PGEXCL OBL fish_name LIN plate TOP IF-call 1PGEXCL LIN container
The grammaticalization (Hopper & Traugott 1993) of ya from a deictic "this" to a third person
singular nominal pronoun "he/she/it" and eventually a modal auxiliary is a topic for future study.
The pot in which we cook rahet fish and the plate on which we put it are what we call raratan container.
